title: Introduction to the smapr package
text: datasets interested spatial grids. smapr package can extract data raster objects extract_smap function, takes dataset name argument. names paths can generated output list_smap. example, want get rootzone soil moisture, can see dataset name sm_rootzone_analysis group /Analysis_Data, path dataset /Analysis_Data/sm_rootzone_analysis: extract data data frame local_files, generating terra SpatRaster object one layer per file: can visualize layer: plot chunk plot-raster Cropping, masking, summarization can proceed using terra R package. example, get mean soil moisture values across layers, useterra::app(): plot chunk get-mean
code: sm_raster <- extract_smap(local_files, '/Analysis_Data/sm_rootzone_analysis') sm_raster #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 1624, 3856, 8  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 8984.982, 8205.308  (x, y) #> extent      : -17367530, 17278561, -6010879, 7314541  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : +proj=cea +lat_ts=30 +lon_0=0 +x_0=0 +y_0=0 +datum=WGS84 +units=m +no_defs  #> source      : tmp.tif  #> names       : SMAP_~0_001, SMAP_~0_001, SMAP_~0_001, SMAP_~0_001, SMAP_~0_001, SMAP_~0_001, ...  #> min values  :   0.0065597,  0.00659073, 0.006612024, 0.006668247, 0.006737789, 0.006590234, ...  #> max values  :   0.8000000,  0.80000001, 0.800000012, 0.800000012, 0.800000012, 0.800000012, ... plot(sm_raster) mean_sm <- app(sm_raster, fun = mean) plot(mean_sm, main = 'Mean soil moisture')

title: Introduction to the smapr package
text: SPL4SMAU data estimated surface rootzone soil moisture layers. want compare values, can load surface soil moisture data, compute mean value layers rootzone soil moisture raster, generate scatterplot. plot chunk surface-vs-rootzone
code: surface_raster <- extract_smap(local_files,                                name = '/Analysis_Data/sm_surface_analysis')  mean_surface_sm <- app(surface_raster, fun = mean)  # compare values plot(values(mean_sm), values(mean_surface_sm), col = 'dodgerblue', cex = .1,      xlab = 'Rootzone soil moisture', ylab = 'Surface soil moisture', bty = 'n') abline(0, 1, lty = 2)

text: Multiple SMAP data products provided NSIDC, products vary amount processing. Currently, smapr primarily supports level 3 level 4 data products, represent global daily composite global three hourly modeled data products, respectively. wide variety data layers available SMAP products, including surface soil moisture, root zone soil moisture, freeze/thaw status, surface temperature, vegetation water content, vegetation opacity, net ecosystem carbon exchange, soil temperature, evapotranspiration. NSIDC provides documentation SMAP data products website, provide summary data products supported smapr .

text: high level, workflows follow steps: Find SMAP data find_smap() Download data download_smap() List data contents list_smap() Extract data extract_smap() steps outlined :

title: Acquisition and Processing of NASA Soil Moisture Active-Passive (SMAP) Data
text: Data hosted server National Snow Ice Data Center. find_smap() function searches specific data products returns data frame available data. data mature pass checks, versions advance. specific time, versions datasets dates may exist. date overview dataset versions, see NSIDC SMAP data version webpage.
code: library(smapr) library(terra) #> terra 1.7.18 available_data <- find_smap(id = "SPL3SMAP", date = "2015-05-25", version = 3) str(available_data) #> 'data.frame':    1 obs. of  3 variables: #>  $ name: chr "SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001" #>  $ date: Date, format: "2015-05-25" #>  $ dir : chr "SPL3SMAP.003/2015.05.25/"

title: Acquisition and Processing of NASA Soil Moisture Active-Passive (SMAP) Data
text: Given data frame produced find_smap, download_smap downloads data onto local file system. Unless directory specified argument, data stored user’s cache. SMAP data provided HDF5 format, one file actually multiple data sets, including metadata. list_smap function allows users inspect contents downloaded data high level (= FALSE) depth (= TRUE). see data fields, set = TRUE.
code: downloads <- download_smap(available_data) #> Downloading https://n5eil01u.ecs.nsidc.org/SMAP/SPL3SMAP.003/2015.05.25/SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001.h5 #> Downloading https://n5eil01u.ecs.nsidc.org/SMAP/SPL3SMAP.003/2015.05.25/SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001.qa #> Downloading https://n5eil01u.ecs.nsidc.org/SMAP/SPL3SMAP.003/2015.05.25/SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001.h5.iso.xml str(downloads) #> 'data.frame':    1 obs. of  4 variables: #>  $ name     : chr "SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001" #>  $ date     : Date, format: "2015-05-25" #>  $ dir      : chr "SPL3SMAP.003/2015.05.25/" #>  $ local_dir: chr "~/.cache/smap" list_smap(downloads, all = FALSE) #> $SMAP_L3_SM_AP_20150525_R13080_001 #>                           name group     otype dclass  dim #> 1                     Metadata     . title: Find SMAP data — find_smap
text: many SMAP data products can accessed function. Currently, smapr supports level 3 level 4 data products, associated Data Set ID specified id argument, described https://nsidc.org/data/smap/smap-data.html summarized : SPL2SMAP_S SMAP/Sentinel-1 Radiometer/Radar Soil Moisture SPL3FTA Radar Northern Hemisphere Daily Freeze/Thaw State SPL3SMA Radar Global Daily Soil Moisture SPL3SMP Radiometer Global Soil Moisture SPL3SMAP Radar/Radiometer Global Soil Moisture SPL4SMAU Surface/Rootzone Soil Moisture Analysis Update SPL4SMGP Surface/Rootzone Soil Moisture Geophysical Data SPL4SMLM Surface/Rootzone Soil Moisture Land Model Constants SPL4CMDL Carbon Net Ecosystem Exchange function requires username password NASA's Earthdata portal. Earthdata username password, pass using set_smap_credentials() function. yet username password, register one : https://urs.earthdata.nasa.gov/

title: Find SMAP data — find_smap
code: if (FALSE) { # looking for data on one day: find_smap(id = "SPL4SMGP", dates = "2015-03-31", version = 4)  # searching across a date range start_date <- as.Date("2015-03-31") end_date <- as.Date("2015-04-02") date_sequence <- seq(start_date, end_date, by = 1) find_smap(id = "SPL4SMGP", dates = date_sequence, version = 4) }
